articles.title: Coco Lee: Disney star and pop singer dies at 48 - BBC
articles.description: She enjoyed stardom in Asia and voiced the lead character in the Mandarin version of Disney's Mulan.
articles.content:
Singer Coco Lee, who enjoyed pop stardom in Asia in the 1990s and 2000s, has died at the age of 48.
Born in Hong Kong, Lee moved to the US as a child and released albums in Mandarin and English.
